reviews.title: Home sweet Home
reviews.text: Let us start by saying this is our second time traveling, my wife and I are 38 years young.This is the first time we've traveled by ourselves, that said let's talk about Blue Bay.When we arrived at Blue Bay we were welcomed 3 times before getting to the front desk once checked in our bags where whisked away to our room.Once in our room we didn't have to wait long for our luggage to get there.The bellhop was more then helpful to show us how to work the air conditioner and the safe.Once settled in we showered and cleaned up and went for supper at the buffet we were surprised to see the variety of hot meal offered and I mean hot especially for being after 8p.m.When we returned to our room after supper we were amazed to see clean towels.The next day my wife and I met the animation team,my wife is a (BBW)and treated her the same as anyone else.The bartender at the swim up bar remembered me without even tipping him, he addressed me by my first name along with a presidente(beer).We tried all 3 a la carte restaurant and they were fantastic.The first one we tried was the seafood one I was amazed at the size of the lobster it was at least 5 lbsand it was fresh wich cost 30 dollars u.s. My wife enjoyed the seafood lasagna which she says was excellent.The second one was the chinesse there again the food was very good and i am not really one for chinesse food but i enjoyed it. The third one was the grill and was worth the wait.A word of advise book your a la carte asap because they book up really fast.The beach service was great they were more than happy to serve you drinks at 10a.m. if you chose too.The ocean floor was as smooth as the beach.Very windy in the afternoon but that was ok because it gave us a chance to enjoy the swim up bar were we met friends form around the world.(hello to shelly and john fromu.s eh and vickie and bobbie from england also joe and karens from wells xoxo).Even at the pool side they would come and serve you.At night we would take in the shows which were great and the animation team (Lucas, capuccino,and super Tino) got my wife up to dance which she rarly dances.The animation team works very hard to keep everybody entertained we love you guys.Every time you would see a staff member they always had a smile for you.Over all my wife and I talk about Blue Bay to our friends and family non stop.The only thing we would change about our trip would be more space room on the plane.My wife and I would go back to Blue Bay in a heart beat.We will be back(only 365days to go) thanks for everything guys from your friends in canada (Chris and Linda )XXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXX

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We arrived at the airport late morning and everything went smoothly. There was a rep desk outside the airport that instructed you to your shuttle to the hotel. Our shuttle was very small, which made me happy as that meant not a lot of people were checking in at once. It was about a 20 minute drive to the front door of our resort. Check-in was a breeze. There was only about 6 other people were checking in at the same time. There was a lady who did a little welcome speech with a package of information about the resort. Also provided were a cool towel and a cold non-alcoholic drink. Our room wasn’t ready yet so we parked our luggage with the front desk and went exploring. They have staff watching the luggage so we felt comfortable leaving it there.
reviews.title: BlueBay Exceeded Our Expectations

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was finally ready about 3pm that same day. A porter brought our luggage to our room which was exactly the type of room requested, a room not on the ground level, facing the ocean. The only problem was the group of 20-somethings that brought their stereo and had it cranked so loud our room was shaking. We got to our room, looked at each other and said “forget this!” Went back to the main lobby and requested a room change. They were very accommodating and immediately took us to another room on the opposite side of the resort. It was on the ground level, but clean and had a king size bed instead of two double beds. The only reason we didn’t want a ground level room was that they have doors connecting you to the next room. Our neighbours were heavy smokers who seemed to sit in their room all day and smoke and being an ex-smoker, it doesn’t usually bother me but we just stuffed a towel against the bottom of the door and it was fine.
reviews.title: Friendly Staff. And Good Service..but..be aware

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The beds are firm and comfortable, with four pillows. The room lacked seating though. There is a safe available to use in the room for $15 US for the week. You have to request a card from the front desk to use it. Also, AS SOON AS YOU ARRIVE and get your welcome package, book your A La Carte’s with Guest Services. They fill up quickly and some days certain ones aren’t open. Just remember not to book one on Tuesday night as they have a Managers Welcome Party along with a very nice dinner in the buffet. The A La Carte's are the Grill, El Dorado, an Oriental Infusion called the Jade Garden and a Seafood restaurant, El Pescador. The food was lovely at all of them, but I enjoyed the main buffet just as much, especially Thursday night when they had a Mexican theme. There was an amazing assortment of food at the main buffet every day. I am a vegan and my husband is a meat eater, but there was enough of an assortment that neither of us got bored. They even had soy milk for breakfast cereals! At the Grill A la Carte my husband ordered the chateaubriand. Be warned that it is meant for TWO people to consume but obviously wasn’t something I was going to partake in. My husband was a bit embarrassed with the platter of food that came out but enjoyed it nonetheless. The Oriental Restaurant is open to other resort guests as well, but they have to pay. My husband had a Thai dish, along with a spring roll for appetizer and complimentary sushi. At the Seafood restaurant he ordered the calamari which unfortunately must have been sitting under a heat lamp for some time as they were so tough but he really enjoyed the linguini with prawns. All of the A la Carte's had vegetarian options that were easily made vegan for me. Also, be aware that your wine glass is bottomless. Every time I looked back, at a waiter was there refilling it. Lol. Also, we chatted with a few other guests and never heard anyone say anything bad about the food, or receiving anything undercooked. The only food we both did not enjoy was the pasta station in the main buffet as we found the pasta overcooked. (Should be cooked al dente, but obviously hard to do that when it’s pre-cooked and then re-cooked on the pan with your choice of ingredients) The buffet section also had a lovely low-fat, reduced calorie section with food tips.
reviews.title: Beautiful resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We decided to use the advice of fellow travelers who had posted information about using Felix to book our tours through, and were very glad we did. We wanted to do a horseback riding excursion and the hotel wanted $51 per person for a ½ day trip. They would not do a full day trip as they wouldn’t guarantee the food off of the resort (for lunch). We booked with Felix for a full day at $65 per person and had an amazing time. We rode from 0900 – 1430 with three breaks, two for a drink and one for lunch. The food was amazing! Also what was nice was that the tour only consisted of my husband, myself and two tour guides. (Usually at these you end up with a group of 20 people!) Also the horses weren’t the trail horse kind that just followed the one in front. You had to actually control the horse. Tip though, Felix tells you to wear your bathing suit under your clothes as you get an opportunity at the first break to go for a swim in the ocean. Women: wear a bra under your bathing suit! I was stupid and wore just my bathing suit and was in pain the entire time. Lol

reviews.text: Visited Blue Bay with another couple during the week of April 10-17, 2008. This was their first time in the Caribean and but it was our tenth visit. We have travelled to Cuba 6 times, Mexico once and this was our second time to Dominican Republic. We have been to resorts ranging from 21/2 stars to 5 stars. Each of them stood out for different reasons. The Riu Yucatan resort in Mexico stood out for its food and drinks while all of the Cuban resorts stood out for their beach and entertainment. The Blue Bay was by far one of my favourite resorts that we have visited and give it top marks for its ambience, layout and above all service. The food was also top notch but it is not what makes this resort a real gem.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Let me begin by saying that I took much time researching prior to booking the Blue Bay. I checked tripadvisor and many other sites to find a perfect combination of what we and the other couple were looking for. I read the majority of the reviews on Blue Bay and like many others I was apprehensive that the reviews appeared almost "too good" and thought that maybe certain reviewers were given incentives for their favourable reviews. I can assure you after visiting this resort that this is not the case. Some of the issues brought up in the negative reviews are accurate. For instance the rooms are a little dark and the beds are definately hard. Also, the entertainment team have room for improvement and the beach is not the nicest that I have seen (in regards to esthetics). Yet some of the negative comments are complete hogwash. The food found throughout the resort is absolutely delicious and I have difficulty how anyone could possibly find fault in the service. I could not believe how friendly everyone was and how willing they were to ensure that your stay was enjoyable. The general manager, Oscar, was present throughout the week and he personally made sure that the bed was to my liking. The dining staff (waitors, etc) were always smiling and worked their behinds off to ensure that you never had an empty glass or dirty dish in front of you. The food was always beatifully prepared and I never left a single meal hungry. I especially appreciated the tasty low fat items and was pleasantly suprised to see how hot every meal was. Even the breakfast items were hot at all times. This is no small feet. I also appreciated eating in the open air buffet restaurant. They kept the food well covered and I did not see or hear of anyone being sick over the food while we were there.
reviews.title: Wonderful, relaxing stay at Blue Bay. Highly Recommend!

likes.disliked: — The pillows left much to be desired.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Another thing that really puts Blue Bay in a league of their own is the layout of the resort and the ambience. The designers obviously took much time and consideration when designing it. Everything from the beautiful lobby, airy buffet restaurant to the music playing throughout was very zen/spa like. I found even the staff uniforms and the furniture to be very well thought out. You could not help but leave your worries behind and totally immerse yourself in this place of casual elegance. I even took pictures of the public bathrooms because I could not get over how beautiful they were. I had never seen this much care put into such minor details. They obviously have realized that it is these minor details that make a resort like Blue Bay stand out. Congradulations on a job well done. We could not have asked for anything more in a vacation.
reviews.title: The Best Of The Best

If you leave small tips for the maids it will go a long away! Our water was replaced each time it ran out, no problem at all.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009
reviews.text: I have travelled abroad long haul every Xmas and new year since 1999 and always ejoyed however BlueBay is probably a cut above my usual standard. Thoroughly deserves its 4 stars, the place is beautifuly kept and the staff ratio must be about 1-2-1. It is nice to have adults only but the entertainment staff made us feel like kids again, do take advantage of the fun and games, they work so hard and it doesnt matter if you make a prat of yourself on holiday. Two things struck me - the standard of food was excellent and the restaurant staff fly about keeping you topped up with drinks, also for those who like it (and I do) the dancing show were great (I didnt half fancy that Carmelo!) You canot help encountering rain in this part of th world but it wont affect your holiday, its not cold and you are wet already so go in the pool! Also go riding at Lorilar Ranch and rafting on Rio del Norte if you want to have fun. (Age no problem I'm 66 and survived)

reviews.text: Next morning at the rep meeting we asked if this could be changed as my husband had recently had back surgery and it was too uncomfortable for him. The rep (who turned out to be about as much use as a chocolate fireguard) took me to reception and I was assured this would not be a problem and would be sorted today. To cut a long story short, 14 hours later we went to bed and nothing had been done. We went back to reception who basically dismissed our problem saying they could not do anything. To be truthful I was very angry and took some of the cushions from reception to make it more comfortable until an alternative solution could be found. In no time at all reception were on the phone saying we had to return them, we refused. Two minutes later the door knocked. A maid came over with a couple of lumpy pillows which we said was not sufficient, only to be followed by another maid. At this point I was in bed and my husband in his boxers (having got out to answer the door). The second maid used the phone twice, but not speaking Spanish I don't know who she phoned or what was said. The next thing we knew a big burly security guard with the biggest baton just walked straight into our room, banging his baton up and down into his hand and pacing up and down in a threatening and intimidating manner shouting at me even though I told him several times I didn't speak Spanish. The result was we returned the pillows and a couple of bedspreads were provided and folded.
reviews.title: blue bay, great, dont worry about the bad reviews!!!
beware the sales sharks!!!
reviews.text: The next day we went back to see the rep and said we wanted to see the hotel manager as we did not feel confident with the rep`s abilities up to that point. An appointment was made for 5pm that evening. Thank God for Trip Advisor because when we went for this appointment we were greeted by a young lady who introduced herself as the manager and I had read that Mr Oscar Lora was the new manager. I made her aware that it was the manager we wanted to see and eventually we got to see him. He was lovely, very helpful, quietly spoken and said he would discipline the security guard and the mattress would be changed. He pointed out that we should not have taken the pillows which is probably correct but with tiredness and frustration and no body gave us any hope that this issue would even be addressed again, the prospect of 2 weeks with no sleep was not appealing. True to their word, the mattress was changed, not much better but hey, they did change it. From that point the manager was fantastic, he was always around the resort making sure everything ran smoothly and held cocktail parties to meet the guests.

reviews.text: Even though the weather wasn’t the greatest, we had an EXCEPTIONAL holiday.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I’ll be honest with you, the resort is not perfect. We had to wait 2 ½ hours for our room, there is at times a smell on the bridge crossing over to the beach, and I was a bit disappointed because my room didn’t have an inside sitting room, even though I reserved a Standard Room Plus, but when you go on a holiday, you can’t just focus on the negative…..life’s way too short.
reviews.title: Loved it and remember to book trips with the locals!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My boyfriend and I had such a wonderful week and here’s why: The food at the buffet and at the beach snack-bar is very good. The A-la-Carte restaurants are out of this world. The beach, while not as beautiful as Punta Cana or Varadero, is still very nice. The beach is extremely clean and the waiter even comes to our lounge chairs to take our orders (Thank you Pablo, you’re the best). The grounds are immaculate. The flowers and trees are so beautiful…it is breath taking. The animation was wonderful. The games at times can be simple, but so what, you’re there to have a good time and laugh. It’s not Vegas, but believe me with the little amount you pay at Blue Bay, you won’t last long in Vegas. The resort is small so it doesn’t take long that you recognize people and you can, if you wish, make friends very easily. We met wonderful people from the UK, Germany, Canada and Quebec. Speaking of wonderful people, I had the pleasure of meeting Chrissy 007….what a lovely lady she is. The staff is outstanding. Always polite, always smiling….there’s nothing they wouldn’t do for you. Even the vendors are wonderful. If you take a minute to talk to these people, you will discover that Dominicans are genuinely kind people. They work extremely hard for so little money. Take a minute to look at what they have to sell you. It is all hand-made crafts. Dominicans are extremely talented. You don’t have to buy anything if you don’t want to, but please remain polite….it’s the least they deserve. I am always amazed as to how people are so keen on tipping the maid and the bartender…..so why can’t you be just as nice with the vendors. They are human too you know. They walk the beach up and down all day long, wearing long jeans…the least you can do is acknowledge their presence with a nice hola and if you tell them no thank you, they will leave you alone. The pool area is very clean and very beautiful. There's a pool where the activities take place and there's a pool at the Spa which is outstanding. They play soft relazing music and people sit there and read in this peaceful area....but if you want action, you go to the other pool. The maids are outstanding. The room was always kept extremely clean and they are so kind....they were spoiling us all the time with special treats. Our favourites were the Fried Ice Cream at the Chinese Restaurant, the Mahi Mahi at the Seafood Restaurant, the Pasta Counter at the main buffet, the Banana Mama at the Beach Bar (again, Pablo, thank you), the Chateaubriand at the Steak House, the $20 BBQ, the cushion for your feet at the Chinese Restaurant, and the Banana Boat (Merci les filles de Sorel!)
reviews.title: OK - if you get a cheap deal..Come with low expectations & you'll leave happy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My boyfriend and I went to Dominican, Cuba, Mexico….we went to many 4 ½ * and 5*….and I can assure you that Blue Bay Villas Doradas is an outstanding 4 * resort. We would even go as far as saying that it has lots of components from a 5* resort and yet at such a reasonable cost. Blue Bay Villas Doradas is a gem...it really is. Thank you Blue Bay, we had a wonderful week with you guys and we are counting the days until our next trip. Love you all!
reviews.title: This is more like a 2* hotel and not 4* plus as stated in holiday brochure

aka: Bluebay Villas Doradas Hotel Puerto Plata
description: BlueBay Villas Doradas is an Adults Only 24 hour All Inclusive resort in Puerto Plata, was completely refurbished in 2006 providing facilities and rooms of the highest quality. This hotel in Puerto Plata, which is only for the over 18s, is an ideal place for couples to relax or enjoy their honeymoon or wedding. Its location - literally next to the 18-hole Playa Dorada golf course designed by Robert Trent Jones – makes it a favourite among golfers.The hotel’s rooms and suites are equipped to the highest standard, in keeping with the quality of the resort and its recent refurbishment – all include cable TV, mini bars and ironing facilities.
